  <div id="container">
    <div class="docs markdown"><div class="pilwrap" id="clsx">
  <h1>
    <a href="#clsx" name="clsx" class="pilcrow"></a>
clsx <a href="https://github.com/lukeed/clsx/actions?query=workflow%3ACI"><img src="https://github.com/lukeed/clsx/workflows/CI/badge.svg" alt="CI"></a> <a href="https://codecov.io/gh/lukeed/clsx"><img src="https://badgen.net/codecov/c/github/lukeed/clsx" alt="codecov"></a> <a href="https://licenses.dev/npm/clsx"><img src="https://licenses.dev/b/npm/clsx" alt="licenses"></a>
  </h1>
</div>
<blockquote>
<p>A tiny (239B) utility for constructing <code>className</code> strings conditionally.<Br>Also serves as a <a href="bench.html">faster</a> &amp; smaller drop-in replacement for the <code>classnames</code> module.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>This module is available in three formats:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>ES Module</strong>: <code>dist/clsx.mjs</code></li>
<li><strong>CommonJS</strong>: <code>dist/clsx.js</code></li>
<li><strong>UMD</strong>: <code>dist/clsx.min.js</code></li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="install">
  <h2>
    <a href="#install" name="install" class="pilcrow"></a>
Install
  </h2>
</div>
<pre><code>$ npm install --save clsx
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="usage">
  <h2>
    <a href="#usage" name="usage" class="pilcrow"></a>
Usage
  </h2>
</div>
<pre><code class="js"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> clsx <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'clsx'</span>;
<span class="hljs-comment">// or</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> { clsx } <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'clsx'</span>;

<span class="hljs-comment">// Strings (variadic)</span>
clsx(<span class="hljs-string">'foo'</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">true</span> &amp;&amp; <span class="hljs-string">'bar'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'baz'</span>);
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; 'foo bar baz'</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Objects</span>
clsx({ <span class="hljs-attr">foo</span>:<span class="hljs-literal">true</span>, <span class="hljs-attr">bar</span>:<span class="hljs-literal">false</span>, <span class="hljs-attr">baz</span>:isTrue() });
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; 'foo baz'</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Objects (variadic)</span>
clsx({ <span class="hljs-attr">foo</span>:<span class="hljs-literal">true</span> }, { <span class="hljs-attr">bar</span>:<span class="hljs-literal">false</span> }, <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>, { <span class="hljs-string">'--foobar'</span>:<span class="hljs-string">'hello'</span> });
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; 'foo --foobar'</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Arrays</span>
clsx([<span class="hljs-string">'foo'</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'bar'</span>]);
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; 'foo bar'</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Arrays (variadic)</span>
clsx([<span class="hljs-string">'foo'</span>], [<span class="hljs-string">''</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'bar'</span>], [[<span class="hljs-string">'baz'</span>, [[<span class="hljs-string">'hello'</span>], <span class="hljs-string">'there'</span>]]]);
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; 'foo bar baz hello there'</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Kitchen sink (with nesting)</span>
clsx(<span class="hljs-string">'foo'</span>, [<span class="hljs-number">1</span> &amp;&amp; <span class="hljs-string">'bar'</span>, { <span class="hljs-attr">baz</span>:<span class="hljs-literal">false</span>, <span class="hljs-attr">bat</span>:<span class="hljs-literal">null</span> }, [<span class="hljs-string">'hello'</span>, [<span class="hljs-string">'world'</span>]]], <span class="hljs-string">'cya'</span>);
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; 'foo bar hello world cya'</span>
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="api">
  <h2>
    <a href="#api" name="api" class="pilcrow"></a>
API
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="clsx...input">
  <h3>
    <a href="#clsx...input" name="clsx...input" class="pilcrow"></a>
clsx(...input)
  </h3>
</div>
<p>Returns: <code>String</code></p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="input">
  <h4>
    <a href="#input" name="input" class="pilcrow"></a>
input
  </h4>
</div>
<p>Type: <code>Mixed</code></p>
<p>The <code>clsx</code> function can take <strong><em>any</em></strong> number of arguments, each of which can be an Object, Array, Boolean, or String.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Important:</strong> <em>Any</em> falsey values are discarded!<br>Standalone Boolean values are discarded as well.</p>
</blockquote>
<pre><code class="js">clsx(<span class="hljs-literal">true</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>, <span class="hljs-string">''</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">undefined</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">NaN</span>);
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; ''</span>
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="modes">
  <h2>
    <a href="#modes" name="modes" class="pilcrow"></a>
Modes
  </h2>
</div>
<p>There are multiple &quot;versions&quot; of <code>clsx</code> available, which allows you to bring only the functionality you need!</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="clsx-1">
  <h4>
    <a href="#clsx-1" name="clsx-1" class="pilcrow"></a>
<code>clsx</code>
  </h4>
</div>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Size (gzip):</strong> 239 bytes<br>
<strong>Availability:</strong> CommonJS, ES Module, UMD</p>
</blockquote>
<p>The default <code>clsx</code> module; see <a href="#API.html">API</a> for info.</p>
<pre><code class="js"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> { clsx } <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'clsx'</span>;
<span class="hljs-comment">// or</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> clsx <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'clsx'</span>;
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="clsxlite">
  <h4>
    <a href="#clsxlite" name="clsxlite" class="pilcrow"></a>
<code>clsx/lite</code>
  </h4>
</div>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Size (gzip):</strong> 140 bytes<br>
<strong>Availability:</strong> CommonJS, ES Module<br>
<strong>CAUTION:</strong> Accepts <strong>ONLY</strong> string arguments!</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Ideal for applications that <strong><em>only</em></strong> use the string-builder pattern.</p>
<p>Any non-string arguments are ignored!</p>
<pre><code class="js"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> { clsx } <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'clsx/lite'</span>;
<span class="hljs-comment">// or</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> clsx <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-string">'clsx/lite'</span>;

<span class="hljs-comment">// string</span>
clsx(<span class="hljs-string">'hello'</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">true</span> &amp;&amp; <span class="hljs-string">'foo'</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">false</span> &amp;&amp; <span class="hljs-string">'bar'</span>);
<span class="hljs-comment">// =&gt; "hello foo"</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// <span class="hljs-doctag">NOTE:</span> Any non-string input(s) ignored</span>
clsx({ <span class="hljs-attr">foo</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span> });
<span class="hljs-comment">//=&gt; ""</span>
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="benchmarks">
  <h2>
    <a href="#benchmarks" name="benchmarks" class="pilcrow"></a>
Benchmarks
  </h2>
</div>
<p>For snapshots of cross-browser results, check out the <a href="bench.html"><code>bench</code></a> directory~!</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="support">
  <h2>
    <a href="#support" name="support" class="pilcrow"></a>
Support
  </h2>
</div>
<p>All versions of Node.js are supported.</p>
<p>All browsers that support <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/isArray#Browser_compatibility"><code>Array.isArray</code></a> are supported (IE9+).</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> For IE8 support and older, please install <code>clsx@1.0.x</code> and beware of <a href="https://github.com/lukeed/clsx/issues/17">#17</a>.</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="pilwrap" id="tailwind-support">
  <h2>
    <a href="#tailwind-support" name="tailwind-support" class="pilcrow"></a>
Tailwind Support
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Here some additional (optional) steps to enable classes autocompletion using <code>clsx</code> with Tailwind CSS.</p>
<details>
<summary>
  Visual Studio Code
</summary>
<ol>
<li>
<p><a href="https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss">Install the &quot;Tailwind CSS IntelliSense&quot; Visual Studio Code extension</a></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Add the following to your <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/settings"><code>settings.json</code></a>:</p>
</li>
</ol>
<pre><code class="json"> {
  <span class="hljs-attr">"tailwindCSS.experimental.classRegex"</span>: [
    [<span class="hljs-string">"clsx\\(([^)]*)\\)"</span>, <span class="hljs-string">"(?:'|\"|`)([^']*)(?:'|\"|`)"</span>]
  ]
 }
</code></pre>
</details>
<p>You may find the <a href="#clsxlite.html"><code>clsx/lite</code></a> module useful within Tailwind contexts. This is especially true if/when your application <strong>only</strong> composes classes in this pattern:</p>
<pre><code class="js">clsx(<span class="hljs-string">'text-base'</span>, props.active &amp;&amp; <span class="hljs-string">'text-primary'</span>, props.className);
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="related">
  <h2>
    <a href="#related" name="related" class="pilcrow"></a>
Related
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/lukeed/obj-str">obj-str</a> - A smaller (96B) and similiar utility that only works with Objects.</li>
</ul>
